reviews.sentence: Friendly Clean Close to the City. We had a two bedroom apartment. It was clean nice furniture. You could have breakfast at the cafe or room service. The staff were friendly acomodating. Near Chatswod Train Station. There was a choice of Restraunts cafes. Under half an hour drive to the City. Good place to stay if you have family or Business in the area.
Great location near food precinct and railway station urban living at an affordable price. Size of room location and price. Breakfast not up to the usual Mantra quality.

Fantastic location. Location Spacious easy car parking. This is a great location as we needed to be in Central Chatswod area. So easy to leave the hotel to get coffee andor food etc. The room service was overpriced for very stand bistro meal eg chips and a piece schnitzel plonked on a plate.

One night in the Chatswod Mantra. The room was excellent very clean modern comfortable spacious. The room price was excellent but by the time you add up the extras it was not the good deal it first appeared. Parking internet breakfast were all expensive additions.

Always wonderful. Hotel is always clean beds are comfortable staff are fairly friendly and room service is spot on. Perfect for business travel and I can walk to my place of work. I wish they had a rewards program of some sort though. I stay here quite often.

Nice comfy room but terrible service no one smiles no one greets no free wifi housekeeping staff did terrible jobs. Before checking in I had to call again to pay rest of the money one of the staff hung up my call just because she could hear me but not clear her attitude was terrible as well. Hire people with better attitude I am not coming here to see your miserable face. Update your wifi system even cheap hotel has free wifi. The only two staff who smiled at me I assume they are managers please train your employees better.

Convenient to train. The staff were excellent and the room was neat and tidy and clean. it is just that it all seemed so tired and worn out. Train line close so getting into and around Sydney was a breeze. The staff Great location with shops and transport close by Update the rooms shower screen not big enough.

Great location nice place to stay. This place is close to everything and had parking so you can park and forget all about the car for the duration of your stay. Shops restaurants theatre trains all within a 3 minute walk. Our deal included parking breakfast and a 20 gift card which was terrific. Would have been even better if free in room wifi was included as well but you can not have everything. Recommended if Chatswod is your destination.

Huge room but poor cleaning and maintenance. The 2 bedroom unit was huge as it ’s basicsly a 1 bedroom unit and another room put together through joining doors so you get 2 bathrooms. Location was great a little noisy from the railway but that ’s to be expected and did n’t bother us. Also close to shops and restaurants and we were able to get free street parking. Staff were lovely and helpful and the included breakfast was great. Where we were let down was the cleaning and general maintenance of the room. Cleaning there were hairs in the shower marks on the bathroom sink food left behind in the kitchen. Maintenance the oven did n’t work fridge had no shelves in it dishwasher shelf did n’t pull out all the glasses were totally mis matched they ’d been a water leak in the bathroom but they had left the huge ugly brown stains and not painted or got rid of them. Due to the price location and availability we were passing though on Christmas Eve. it suited us but I would n’t stay again unles desperate.

Great location. It was so nice to ar8ve at a hotel and be greeted with a lovely smile that belonged to Kylie at reception. My journey with buses plane trains was exhausting and arriving and to be told by this lovely girl that I could go upto my room was just great. Over my two days all staff were fabulous and so obliging. I wished I had known of this hotel earlier. I will always book in there from here on. Location was excellent with train s and buses within minutes of Mantra Hotel. Staff. location and transport availability. The Hotel has a fabulous Restaurant attached to it. I enjoyed breakfast dinner there. Location is minutes from trains and buses. Westfield shopping Plaza close by. Bars and Restaurants a plenty to choose from. Nothing that I can think of at this time.

Mantra Chatswod 18th to 21st October 2018. The Mantra Chatswod is in dire need of upgrading. The hotel room I stayed in had severe stained carpet lounge felt grubby to sit on and had a very unpleasant odour. I struggled staying in this hotel due to these conditions and I will not be back.

Spacious rooms. Mantra Chatswod has basically all the things you need in a place. It has a well functioning laundry place a basic kitchen and gym. The thing I like about the property is its close proximity to restaurants mall and grocery stores like Woolworths and Coles. It is also very close to the train and bus stations.

Nice but disappointing bathroom. The room was nice good housekeeping. For a 4 star hotel the bathroom was disappointing. I did not expect a shower over the bath with a fixed shower head that was too low for me and a fixed glass panel that made bathing my toddler difficult. Also there was not an exhaust fan.

trouble free and comfortable. enjoyed my stay very much and the little bit extra for a suite was well worth it. Next time I am in Sydney I had be happy to stay here again. Found the shower area too small for anyone of size kept banging my elbows on the wall and the glass. but it was no big deal.

Never again. I recently spent 2 nights at the Mantra as I was in Sydney for work. Never in my life have I been in 3 different rooms over 2 nights. Let ’s start from the beginning. Late afternoon check in was quick efficient but was n’t overly friendly nor was their any explanation on hotel facilities. I checked in to my room 710 and headed straight back to work. Initial impression was that the room size is good but over all very basic. I returned to my room at approximately 10 pm that night and started preparing for bed. I noticed what appeared to be really loud plumbing noises coming from the ceiling of my room. Imagine a shower running in the room above. It was so loud I asked a staff member to come and check it out. I was told that it “ should stop ” and was offered a room on the second floor. I did n’t move rooms at this point as they could n’t confirm that it was a quiet room on level 2 plus it was late and I was exhausted. Well the water noise did n’t stop and continued ALL NIGHT LONG. On my second day after work I returned to the hotel at around 5 pm to organise a new room. I had to go out immediately for a work function so I packed up my bag and left it with the hotel to organise the room. It ’s now 9 pm and I ’m back at the hotel ready to check in to my new hopefully quiet room. Room 916 if I recall. I started unpacking my stuff get a movie happening etc when I realise it ’s really hot in the room. I check the aircon no air. I call the hotel and the Assistant Manager comes to check it out. “ I ’m sorry Sir the aircon is broken ”. Off to room 3 which was on the fourth floor. This time the aircon unit is noisy but I thankfully bought some ear plugs that day so managed to get some sleep. There ’s not much else I can really say about this property as I did n’t really spend a lot of time there. The staff were friendly enough. My wake up calls took place as requested. My room service breakfast was pretty good but prices reflect those of a 5 star hotel and this place ai n’t no 5 starWould I stay here again. No never again. Life is to short and there are plenty of other hotel options in Chatswod. The Mantra really needs to lift its game.
Not cost effective. But worth money spent.

Just do not order the 24hour room service food. Do not on any account order the 24 hour room service food on a weekend when the restaurant is closed. Just trust me it is hideous get Dominos delivered instead if you can not go out to a restaurant or buy Macas on your way to the hotel. Either of these look like 5star dining by comparison with what I got. Note that the closest drive through Macas is at Ryde anything closer is inside a shopping mall. The upholstery looks dirty but it is not a trick of the light makes the pile seem that way but the carpets do need replacing. Then again a floor is a floor and I can live with older carpets. The magnetised cards will work in the lifts but you need to be methodical about putting it in the slot waiting for the green light then pressing your floor number firmly or it does not register. The lift on the far right only gives you 5 seconds literally to get in before closing and the doors will not automatically retract so do not use this lift if you have luggage or someone mobility impaired with you. On the plus side kitchens bathrooms laundries were in good repair we had loads of space our rooms were quiet 715 716 the beds were comfy and the air con worked really well. Our rooms had been pre cooled by staff and we were very grateful for that. The showers were fine for us although one was lower than the other if you are tall ask for a shower with a higher shower head. The shampoo conditioner were really nice and we were left a welcome plate of chocolate slice of some sort which was delicious so I suspect the restaurant at night would be quite good although we did not get to try it. The scrambled eggs in the morning kept hot in a bain marie were unusually oily and pre salted edible but they could be done a lot better. But the rest of the breakfast offerings were pretty good. Staff on the front desk were routinely helpful and obliging seeming to go the extra mile to try and compensate for the hotels shortcomings at the moment. They do a good job. Overall a comfortable enough stay but they really really need to just not serve the 24hour menu at all.

Just do not order the 24hour room service food. Do not on any account order the 24 hour room service food on a weekend when the restaurant is closed. Just trust me it is hideous get Dominos delivered instead if you can not go out to a restaurant or buy Macas on your way to the hotel. Either of these look like 5star dining by comparison with what I got. Note that the closest drive through Macas is at Ryde anything closer is inside a shopping mall. Staff on the front desk were routinely helpful and obliging seeming to go the extra mile to try and compensate for the hotels shortcomings at the moment. They do a good job. Overall a comfortable enough stay but they really really need to just not serve the 24hour menu at all.
Fine. Good room however does seem a bit tired and some things need upgrading.

Good experience with Convenient location and comfortable room. The hotel was in a very convenient location with many train and bus services. There were also many shopping areas nearby. The room was very spacious with a comfortable bed. Staff were polite and friendly. However the room decor looks quite dated and 90s looking especially when comparing to newer hotels around Sydney. It gives a grey and dull feeling. Still I would stay at this hotel again as it was an overall positive experience.

Neither satisfied nor dissatisfied. As this was my first stay at the hotel I was obviously expecting a pleasant stay. Upon checking in the expectations I had prior to arriving at the hotel gradually became lower. Amenities were missing such as slippers toothbrush and toothpaste given that it was a four star hotel. Another problem I encountered was the digital clock appeared to be broken and therefore did not get a wake up call for the time requested. But the biggest disappointment during my stay was having to come to terms with a minor leakage of the drainage pipe of the basin. Due to leaving the water running for a minute or so the bathroom tile became to some degree soaked. Had their been slippers provided it may not have been as bad.
Friendly staffs. Staffs but the property itself showed it aged. The room 916 we stayed Very Smoky Smell lingering. I think it would be coming from the Ventilator.

my stay. Everything was fine great customer service by all. Room was clean and tidy we asked for a late check out due to my car in garage so was happy that i could always a pleasure to stay in a mantra hotel.

convenient location. There is lack of parking not even for drop off and pick up. The water pressure in the shower was terrible. The room was comfortable but not very clean. Although the kitchen is fully equipped there was no tissue or kitchen towels or even cloth towels for kitchen use. I went and bought my own to use.

Good. In general staff were wonderful especially the girl that checked us in and the house keepers. The gentleman seems nice when I asked him a question about the cafe. He actually wanted to find help for me. We received complimentary coffee for joining up but did n’t state the opening hours are 630am to late. I rocked up at a time but told it was closed and reopen at 5 pm. So we missed enjoying the experience at the cafe. When we got there we were told the swimming pool and spa is out of use due to works. I was n’t told before my departure to my stay. Received free wifi but only limited to 3 gb which was ridiculous who does n’t have unlimited wifi these days are hotels. When I booked the hotel it stayed washing machine and dryer was available but when I wanted to do some washing the washing machine wa not present. The staff at the reception said the machines are taken for maintenance. Therefore I had to wash by hand and then place it in the dryer. I think the reception staff could be a bit attentive in acknowledging customers while they walk out in the mornings. It makes the stay more enjoyable.
Good. All overall was good but the one thing is 2 singles bed stick together become queen bed and there is no block with the roller so easily to move when sleep in the middle.

Mantra Chatswod needs total renovation. Everything in this hotel is old. From the lobby to lift and room. As soon as we entered the room strong damp smell is up our nose. Very disappointed. Glad that we are staying only one night.

Very bad service. My wife and I have stayed at the Mantra Hotel – Chatswod NSW twice now and the last time was the worst. We booked for a four day stay in July. I booked a Studio Suite which was supposed to be serviced. I booked through Wotif. The room we were given was an unserviced Studio Suite and no amount of explaining my booking to the Service Desk staff would make them rectify their mistake. There was no refund given or even a discount on the price even though I had paid for a serviced Studio Suite. The Wotif booking went through Expedia and even after contacting them they would not rectify our booking. If there was a minus Star rating for Bad Service I would have chosen that. After months of supposedly sorting out my complaint. Wotif and Expedia have not resolved the issue and have gone silent. We will never stay at the Mantra Hotel – Chatswod NSW again.

Excellent location n ’ service. Got last room with local storm n ’ power outage. Front desk helpful good clean apartment. Has restaurant on site and “ pub ” downstairs. Is knly 200 mts to train station.

Sydney NYE celebration with my mother. This hotel is beautiful and well located. The staff were all welcoming and helpful. However a few things were not working such as the spa did not have hot water when I used it none of the lamps were working there was not rope over the bath tub to hang wet swimming costumes. Otherwise the visit would have been perfect. Went to this hotel as our Sydney NYE celebration. Could see the high fireworks in between buildings this was an unexpected bonus. There were restaurants near by to have dinner which was good because the hotel restaurant was not opened for dinner. I visited with my mother and she enjoyed the breakfast.

Jim n Mary visit OZ. With family members living in Chatswod the Mantra was obvious choice. We checked in and parked in adequate car park. The staff were friendly and welcoming. We chose a 1 bed apartment. This faced the rear so no stunning view but no traffic noise. Room was clean with cooking area. Shower area was clean. The TV was encased in wooden structure which prevented access to HMDI to improve TV viewing. We took breakfast which was ok scrambled eggs were sometimes stale looking and coffee was lukewarm. Staff in restaurant were attentive especially Hermione from Brazil who made us very welcome. The only suggestions to improve would be smaller dishes at breakfast to ensure fresh turnaround and the room TV having Netflix or similar. Will be staying again in the future.

Wonderful. The studio apartment was perfect for me. It was in the perfect location just two minutes walk from Chatswod station. Great toiletries a selection of treats available. The only thing missing was black tea bags. Herbal tea is provided. All the staff were very friendly courteous. I ’d happily stay again.

Well Located for our needs. Moved three rooms as we were staying for a week. The first one Level 9 had the lounge made up as a bed as requested but we are elderly and would have had to make the bed every night to watch TV which was not acceptable. Level 2 room 201 was so gloomy and right next to the air vents was just terrible and we were down in Sydney to sort my Brother in Laws Estate which still a very stressful exercise and ongoing. The last unit 512 was lovely and under the circumstances was a lot happier. Please see that there are enough coat hangers for trousers etc.

A convenient location. Staff were friendly and the room though well appointed and clean had a stale cigarette smoke smell which was unpleasant. After our s my credit card was overcharged for 20 Instead of 195. This was rectified when I sent a query. Also at check in Reception did not make clear verbally that secure car parking would cost 25. There was a form with highlighted text but I did not have my reading glasses with me so I could not read it properly and so was surprised when the charge was 195 rather than the stated 170. overall though it was a convenient overnight s but I will probably s somewhere else next time.

Very good. Unfortunately we did n’t enjoy staying in our studio room. The air con does n’t work well temp set at 18 degrees ans it was barely cool. The hot water in the shower is just above a trickle. We did book two nights at reasonable rates and was told upon arrival that there will be no housekeeping as we are staying two nights. Overall very basic with no housekeeping or free wifi in room. On the plus side location is excelent railway station 1 min walk away and lots of restaurants and shops nearby.
Good. Rooms have Balconies spacious rooms. Don’t have smart TVs in room. Extra charges to price you reserve with bokingcom. Hold bond but never release it.

Great position friendly staff. We go to Sydney for me to see a specialist every 4 months. The Mantra is located in an amazing spot restaurants and markets really close which is major for us and my disability which means walking is a big issue. The staff are so helpful and nice. Rooms recently renovated are superb spacious really clean and set up well. I also suffer from claustrophobia and am always given a room with a balcony upon request. I highly recommend this motel and we will always be back.

very well located. Your staff on arrival were lovely however I felt my room was lacking in a number of areas. Firstly the room had a dreadful smell probably due to overuse of the aircon. I opened the glass doors on a number of occasions to let in some fresh air. Secondly there was no guest book etc that actually told me when I had to check out or any of the other stuff I would expect about the facilities. No idea of how to use the TV. No washing machine dryer only no face washer one bin only in the bathroom. Not enough milk for 2 nights when there was no further room service. No extra pillows.

Great service very handy position. Ideally situated in Chatswod close to trains taxis shopping and of course an amazing array of places to eat. Service is great. Good rooms. My only complaint is the breakfast buffet could be fresher. Overall a good experience and I have stayed here a few nights now.

Great location missing a lot. We came for a long stay 38 days in Chatswod. I booked it for location and pool it was reasonably priced and reviews of upgrades were good. Great location 1 minute from station which itself has bottle shop grocery store sushi coffee dollar store post office and more. So close to the heart of Chatswod. Staff are super friendly and helpful. Long stayers get a welcome pack of oil spray milk eggs bread rice etc which was a great touch. On the flip side cleaning service was only once a week m which is n’t adequate and on the day she came both kids were doing online classes and I was on a work call but she said she could n’t come back later so we had to hover in various places to get out of her way and manage the vacuum. The vacuuming was n’t very thorough and I ’m not sure if she mopped the bathroom or kitchen as walking around in socks got them filthy. The balcony was large but not touched. Fabulous black out curtains in both living room and bedroom and fairly quiet location. Our apartment was about 20 metres for an office building so no view. Secure floors card system for apartment and gym pool was good. Doors slam shut very loudly and the smell of garbage occasionally wafts in some places. Living room. Pullout couch was easy to work and comfy as those things go but we had to ask for bedding for it. TV was a smart TV but no internet so no Netflix nor could I get the screen mirroring to work to stream from our devices. This was a pretty big letdown. Wifi was good. Decent size 1 bd apartment but too sparse. I specifically had asked for a desk but there was n’t one. No place for me to work with only the most uncomfortable stools at the kitchen bench. Balcony was big but filthy and no furniture to use the space. See pic. Bedroom. Comfortable king bed but awkward bedding Not quite big enough bottom sheet and comforter between two sheets that always came undone. I ’d asked for two singles but it came as a king. Bedroom had small TV no alarm clock bedside lamps with USB power which is handy. Closet was big enough with regular type hangers ironing board and iron and safe. No drawers for smalls and no artwork made it very sparse. Windows opened to a locked position for security. Wonderfully dark at night. Kitchen. Decent size but stocked with only bare basic dishes etc with no extras not even salt. Kitchen tap rushes out spraying everywhere and there was n’t a dish drying rack. There ’s a dish washer that seemed to clean fine fine but racks in it were broken and only one sachet of detergent. Dish soap is provided in little sachets. There was no fry pan. I had to wash the light fan unit as it was sticky and gross to the touch. Bathroom. Despite having booked for three people only two towels were provided. Huge roach in bathroom but this is n’t unusual in this part of Chatswod. Bathtub was big but missing a plug. Shower worked fine basics like soap shampoo etc were provided but no soap dish for the soap. Laundry. machines worked fine only one sachet of laundry detergent with no instructions. No laundry drying rack. Other pool sauna and gym were adequate and enjoyed. Hot tub was out of order. Had to ask for. Fry panToaster original one did n’t workPlug for bathBeding for pullout couchTowelsTisuesToilet paperGarbage bagsLaundry detergentDish detergent Conclusion Not quite a hotel that has regular service and not quite an Airbnb with personality and more everyday stuff one needs. Seems to be targeted to short stays which would be fine because of the location and the staff. Pics are disgusting balcony decent pool out of order hot tub.
